course.title: Introduction to Islamic Philosophy and Theology: Formative and Classical Periods (8th to 17th C.)
course.meeting_text: Th., 3-5, and a weekly section to be arranged
course.description: An introductory survey of the development of Islamic theology and philosophy. We will examine and discuss some of the central problems that were much debated through the centuries, such as: the relationship between philosophy and faith; whether humans possess free will; how to understand apparently anthropomorphic expressions in Scripture; whether acts are good because God commands them or God commands them because they are good; and proofs for the existence of God.
course.notes: Offered alternate years with Islamic Civilizations 145b. Though the two courses can be taken in either order, 145a covers the 8th-17th centuries and 145b covers the 19th-20th centuries. Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 3602.
